skill.name: ai-sdk
skill.description: Documentation and reference skill for Vercel AI SDK. Helps developers build AI-powered features using OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and other AI providers through unified APIs.
skill.summary: Build AI-powered applications with Vercel AI SDK. Reference documentation for generateText, streamText, agents, tools, and structured output across multiple providers.
skill.author: vercel

security_audit.summary: Documentation and reference skill containing no executable code. Static findings flagged shell commands (curl, jq, grep) and URLs in documentation examples. These are user-facing documentation showing how to fetch model lists from the AI Gateway API and search local documentation. All findings are false positives - the skill contains only markdown documentation files with example code patterns, no actual code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Build AI features with Vercel AI SDK
content.value_statement: Building AI-powered features requires navigating complex provider APIs, streaming implementations, and type-safe patterns. This skill provides comprehensive documentation reference for the Vercel AI SDK, helping developers implement text generation, tool calling, structured output, and agents with OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and other providers through unified APIs.
actual_capabilities: Answer questions about Vercel AI SDK APIs including generateText, streamText, ToolLoopAgent, and embed functions
Provide code examples for integrating AI providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) with the unified AI Gateway
Guide developers through type-safe agent patterns using InferAgentUIMessage and tool definitions
Reference common error patterns and migration guides for deprecated APIs
Help resolve TypeScript type errors when using useChat and agent consumption
Fetch current model IDs from AI Gateway API for up-to-date model selection
limitations: This is a documentation reference skill - it does not execute code or install packages directly
Does not provide direct access to user environment variables or credentials
Cannot modify user project files - only provides guidance and code examples
Relies on local ai package documentation or ai-sdk.dev for current API references

use_cases.title: Implement AI text generation and streaming
use_cases.description: Get step-by-step guidance for adding AI text generation to applications using generateText and streamText with any supported provider.

use_cases.title: Build type-safe AI agents
use_cases.description: Learn how to create agents with tools, implement InferAgentUIMessage for end-to-end type safety, and render tool invocations with correct types in React components.

use_cases.title: Fix AI SDK integration errors
use_cases.description: Reference common error patterns and migration guides when encountering type errors or deprecated API usage in AI SDK implementations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic AI SDK question
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use generateText with Anthropic? Show me the basic setup and how to handle the response.
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting started with AI SDK text generation

prompt_templates.title: Tool calling implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a tool with the AI SDK. I need to define a weather tool that takes a location and returns temperature. Show the tool definition and how to use it with generateText.
prompt_templates.scenario: Implementing tool calling with custom tools

prompt_templates.title: useChat integration
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use useChat with type safety? I need to use InferAgentUIMessage with my agent defined in lib/agents/my-agent.ts.
prompt_templates.scenario: Integrating agents with React useChat hook

prompt_templates.title: Debug TypeScript errors
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm getting a TypeScript error when using the AI SDK: [paste error]. The error mentions something about toolInvocation. How do I fix this?
prompt_templates.scenario: Resolving type errors in AI SDK usage

output_examples.input: How do I use generateText with OpenAI?
How do I create a type-safe agent?
What models are available through AI Gateway?
output_examples.output:
To fetch the latest model list from AI Gateway:

```bash
# Get all models
curl -s https://ai-gateway.vercel.sh/v1/models

# Filter for Anthropic models (newest first)
curl -s https://ai-gateway.vercel.sh/v1/models | jq -r '[.data[] | select(.id | startswith("anthropic/")) | .id] | reverse | .[]'
```

The gateway provides unified access to OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and other providers through a single API.

best_practices: Always use the AI Gateway provider for multi-provider flexibility - it provides unified access to all supported models through a single API
Use InferAgentUIMessage for end-to-end type safety when consuming agents with useChat - this gives you typed access to tool inputs and outputs
Check node_modules/ai/docs/ for current APIs before relying on memory - APIs change frequently and training data may be outdated
anti_patterns: Using hardcoded model IDs from memory - always fetch current model IDs from AI Gateway as they change with new releases
Relying on deprecated APIs like maxTokens (use maxOutputTokens), parameters (use inputSchema), or generateObject (use generateText with output)
Using toDataStreamResponse with useChat - use toUIMessageStreamResponse instead for proper UI integration

faq.question: What providers does the AI SDK support?
faq.answer: The AI SDK supports OpenAI, Anthropic, Google (Gemini), Amazon Bedrock, Azure, and many others through provider packages. The AI Gateway provides unified access to multiple providers.

faq.question: How do I choose between generateText and streamText?
faq.answer: Use generateText for simple text completion. Use streamText for real-time streaming responses where you want to display text as it generates. streamText also supports tool calling with streaming.

faq.question: What is the AI Gateway and should I use it?
faq.answer: The AI Gateway is a unified API that provides access to models from multiple providers. It is recommended as the default choice because it offers consistent APIs, automatic retries, and unified billing across providers.

faq.question: How do I get type-safe tool rendering with useChat?
faq.answer: Use InferAgentUIMessage<typeof yourAgent> to infer the UIMessage type. This gives you typed tool parts (tool-weather, tool-calculator) with correct input and output types for each tool in your agent.

faq.question: Where should I store agent and tool files?
faq.answer: Recommended structure: lib/agents/ for agent definitions and lib/tools/ for individual tool definitions. This keeps agent logic separate from UI components while allowing type exports for consumption.

faq.question: How do I fix common useChat type errors?
faq.answer: Common issues include: part.input may be undefined during streaming (check part.state first), tool parts have specific state-dependent properties, and toolInvocation has been renamed to typed tool parts like tool-weather.
